intro: Connarus macrophyllus, commonly known as the large-leaf connarus, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, glossy leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. Connarus macrophyllus is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and secondary growth areas.
